data.title: THROUGH THE LIBRARY TO PROVENCE
data.text:
A hallway within the Church Street library leads to this cafe.I found the service of beverages frustratingly slow,having been handed a croissant(only luke warmed up after requesting warming and with no plate) and having to wait and wait for a hot chocolate.The beverage was very good,served in a requested ceramic mug rather than paper cup and for 50 cents extra,topped with a very large chunk of marshmallow.
Tables and chairs are charming but the place was very drafty.Most bothersome to me was the floor.It looked as if it had neither been mopped nor swept for a very long time.

data.title: Avoid style and enjoy the substance of Provence
data.text: Visited Saturday morning for coffee. There's always something comforting ordering croissants when you know they are made and baked by the shop.  This was the only real bakers I discovered in Nashville... a find. Shun the chains and head for Provence.

data.title: Great Sandwich
data.text: We slept in after a long night and wanted something quick and easy. My husband picked up a couple breakfast sandwiches and came back to the hotel. Delishious egg sandwiches. Would definitely return next time we come back into town.

data.title: Meh.
data.text: We went here for breakfast on a Sunday. It was fine, but not spectacular. We were there 45 min after they opened in the morning, so you'd expect fresh pastries. Instead, the shelves were pretty bare and they tasted a day old. Slight step up from grocery store pastries.

data.title: Good coffee and tasty pastries
data.text: Stopped in for coffee and some pastries.  Good selection of pastries, sandwiches, and salads.  Everything is made fresh in-house.  Also offers a selections of cakes and sweets to satisfy the sugar craving when it hits!

data.title: good pastries in a comfortable space
data.text: Provence is located adjacent to the public library, a few blocks away from Broadway, close to the Sheraton Hotel.  It has very good pastries, breakfast sandwiches and espresso drinks.  It also serves lunch; the soup was very good, the sandwich was not as good as the pastries.  There is lovely patio.

data.title: Excellent choice for breakfast or lunch in downtown next to Library
data.text: This is a nice, clean, reasonable place to sit down and have a pastry and coffee or soup and sandwich.  They also have a take out cooler with vegetarian and fruit salads.  Free wifi, nice crowd, outside and inside seating.

data.title: --- I Like It-- Day Off At The Library
data.text:
Back when I worked part-time, I used to spend a day a week in the library studying and I looked forward to lunch at Provence.  Still do when I have a day off, or on a weekend.  

Nashville Public Library is one of my favorite places in Nashville (see my 5/6/12 TripAdvisor review, http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g55229-d2645465-r129463170-Nashville_Public_Library-Nashville_Tennessee.html).

One of the best parts of the library-- and well-planned, I might add-- is the inclusion of Provence Bakery at street level on the Church and 8th Street corner of the Library building.

A tasteful facsimile of a French bistro, with wooden bistro folding chairs, Provence sells tasty and high-quality lunches, snacks, and pre-made and on-order sandwiches, soups, and other foods.  Not to mention baked cookies, meringues, and other sweets.  

And maybe you're in a hotel nearby and want a fresh loaf of bread.

On a reasonable day (not one that's 95 degrees and 80% humidity like the July day when I'm writing), buy a sandwich and drink and eat on the Library courtyard upstairs-- fountains and everything.

Provence is a café and sells coffee.  And take your time and enjoy.

data.title: Desserts!
data.text: They have so many diferente pastries and sweets. We had chocolate covered marshmallow, sugar cookies and macaroons. They were fresh and delicious!

data.title: Lunch at Provence Cafe after touring Belmount Mansion
data.text: We stopped by Provence after touring Belmount Mansion. The food was very fresh and eclectic. Sandwiches come with a small salad instead of chips, which was very refreshing. They have many cafe type of menu items and make sandwiches to order. The sandwiches are made fresh, and are uniquely seasoned. We finished our lunch a small chocolate tart, which was equally delicious. The cafe appears to have internet access for patrons. I highly recommend this cafe.

data.title: Good Boutique Food
data.text: Great place to stop in for French take out.  The food is well-prepared, and the selection of food and beverages is good.  The only downside is that parking can be a hassle.

data.title: Brkfst
data.text: My husband and I had the brkfst panini, it was good but VERY LITTLE on it. If u want a light brkfst its ok. Place needs cleaned

data.title: Nice atmosphere
data.text: Nice cafe atmosphere for a relaxing meal or coffee.  Panini and soup were good. On both visits I made the service was very weak.

data.title: Great coffee
data.text: Finally!b A place to get good coffee in Nashville!! Sorry but the stuff people pass off for coffee in Nashville is revolting. You will love the coffee at Provence but the pastries are even better. A great place to grab a delicious breakfast

data.title: Like being in France
data.text: Pain au chocolate in Nashville?  Who'd a thunk it?  Passed by this bakery/cafe and thought I'd give it a try and was not disappointed.  Excellent bread!

data.title: Great breakfast, many options.
data.text: Great breakfast spot if you're in the area.  Diverse menu and good portion sizes.  Decent coffee.  Would recommend to try.

data.title: Great Bakery and Cafe
data.text: I've been here many times.  It's a nice bakery that is reminiscent of cafes you would find in NYC.  You can come in with your notebook computer and spend all the time you want.  Breads, cakes and  deli offerings are always fresh.  The coffee is one of the best I've had, but they are a little slow at refilling the creamers, so you might have to remind them that they're empty.

data.title: best coffee and sandwich shop & bakery
data.text:
We were recently in Nashville and were treated so well here. We had the best bakery and coffee . The coffee seemed to be a bottomless cup,and it was wonderful,as were the specialty coffee drinks.
Every day there was a lunch special.(very good,also)
The menu also included hot breakfast choices that were great.
also bought some chocolate,the best ever.
Having meals here was a great addition to a wonderful trip.
Thanks to the manager,Mr. Ben Hassell.

data.title: Slightly underwhelmed, and definitely overpriced
data.text: This cute cafe with a great atmosphere fell short on timely service, quality of food preparation, and price.  I would go back, but not on a Sunday morning.

data.title: Just fabulous
data.text: We had such a delicious lunch here. Everything was just perfect - especially the tea and macaroons (real French ones but made by Provence!) I so wish we had a place like this near us in Philadelphia!
